DOC.brief_summary: This is an open-label, uncontrolled, Phase Ib study designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of BAY86-9766 when given as a single agent and in combination with gemcitabine in Asian patients with advanced or refractory solid tumors.Blood samples for PK (pharmacokinetics) analyses will be collected after a single dose of BAY86-9766, multiple doses of BAY86-9766, and combination treatment of gemcitabine and BAY86-9766. Safety evaluation will include adverse events assessment, vital signs, laboratory tests, 12-lead ECG ECG (electrocardiography), cardiac function test, and ophthalmologic examination at various time points during the study.
DOC.brief_title: BAY86-9766 Plus Gemcitabine Phase I Study in Asian
DOC.criteria: Male or female patients >/= 18 years of age, with histologically or cytologically documented advanced or refractory solid tumors not amenable to standard therapy Patients must have at least one measurable or evaluable tumor lesion according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1 Patients must have a life expectancy of at least 12 weeks, and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG PS) </=1. History of cardiac disease Active clinically serious infections > Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) grade 2 Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection Uncontrolled seizure disorder Undergoing renal dialysis Known bleeding diathesis History of organ allograft Pregnant or breast feeding women
